Dear Mr. Doud,
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 06/22/2023 and 06/27/2023. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a
written corrective action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from
the date of this letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, and you need to speak to someone immediately, please contact the area
manager at (616) 204-6992.

Sincerely,
Cassandra Thomas, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
CCI Rule 400.4166 Discharge plan
(1) When a resident is discharged from institutional
care, all of the following information shall be
documented in the case record within 14 days after
discharge: (e) A statement that the discharge plan
recommendations, including medical and dental

follow up that is needed, have been reviewed with
the resident and with the parent and with the
responsible case manager.
Four of four closed case files reviewed failed to include a statement that the
discharge recommendations were reviewed with the resident, parent and case
manager.
CCI Rule 400.4113 Employee records.
(1)An institution shall maintain employee records
for each employee and shall include documentation
of all of the following information prior to
employment or at the time specified in this rule:
(c) Verification of high school diploma or GED
when specified by rule.
Two of three employee case files reviewed failed to include documentation of
high school diploma or GED as required.
CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to requirements;
staff qualifications
(1) Child caring institutions subject to 42 USC 671
shall not permit a child caring institution staff
member to begin working unless all of the following
has been completed using the forms, and in the
manner, prescribed by the department:
(a) A criminal record check as referenced in R
400.4113(f), including a fingerprintbased check of
national crime information databases, unless an
alternative criminal history check has been
approved by the federal government.
One of three employee files reviewed did not have documentation that a criminal
history check was completed prior to hire.

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows: One
corrective action plan for the 2022 interim inspection was submitted and approved
for the agency. The agency submitted a CAP to address noncompliance with
employee records (R 400.4113) and discharge planning (R 400.4166). The
agency successfully completed the terms of the CAP and have come into
compliance relative to the items listed on the CAP.
Financial Overview
A review of the financial documents for Good Samaritan Rescue Mission were
reviewed. No areas of concern were noted.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was completed and submitted for review.
The assessment documented completion of the terms of the CAP for the 2022
interim review. The agency indicated a plan for continued monitoring and
compliance.
Staff and Youth Interviews
A total of four staff members were interviewed. The two direct care staff were very
knowledgeable about the program and excited about continued outreach
opportunities within the community. A supervisor and administrator were also
interviewed. The current chief administrator advised of his plan to retire within the
next 6 months and is working with all staff for a successful transition.
At the time of the onsite visits, the agency did not have any youth placed in the
facility and as a result no youth interviews were completed.
Description of Agency Walk Through
A walk through of the agency was completed and the facility was found to be
appropriately staffed and very well maintained. No areas of concern were noted.

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
